alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Lincoln; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 12:08PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cabell, Lincoln and eastern Wayne Counties through 1245 PM EST... At 1208 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Kiahsville, or 9 miles southeast of Wayne, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wayne, Hamlin, Ranger, Gill, East Lynn Lake, Spurlockville, Kiahsville, Dunlow, Harts, West Hamlin, Sweetland, Branchland, Salt Rock, Palermo, East Lynn, Mud and Myra. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 PM EST for central and western West Virginia.
